{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2012}} {{Infobox military person | name = David Alan Cranston |honorific_suffix = {{post-nominals|post-noms=CBE}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1945|10|20|df=y}} | birth_place = | death_place = | image = |alt= | caption = | nickname = | allegiance = {{UK}} | serviceyears = 1966–1995 | rank = [[Brigadier]] | branch = {{army|United Kingdom}} | unit = [[Royal Artillery]]
[[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|Army Air Corps]] | commands = Commander, [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|4 Regiment, Army Air Corps]] (1986-1988)
[[Chief of Staff]], [[2nd Infantry Division (United Kingdom)|2nd Infantry Division]](1988-1990)
Commander, [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|British Army Aviation]], Germany (1990-1992)
Deputy, Head of Mission, [[European Union Monitoring Mission]] to the former Yugoslavia (1992)
Deputy Commander, [[Multinational Division Central|Multinational Airmobile Division]], Germany (1994-1995) | current position= | battles =[[Yugoslav Wars]] | awards =[[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]] | laterwork = Director General, [[National Association of Pension Funds]] }} '''[[Brigadier]] David Alan Cranston''', [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (born 20 October 1945) is a retired senior [[British Army]] officer.{{Who's Who |surname=Cranston |othernames=David Alan |id=U12246 |volume=2016 |edition=November 2015 online |accessdate=29 December 2015}} He was Director General of the [[National Association of Pension Funds]] from 2000-2001.{{cite web |url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/249291398/1422D0AD61C354E7650/2?accountid=15842 |title=Cranston to depart as NAPF director-general |newspaper=[[Financial Times]] |date=14 December 2001 |page=24 |accessdate=5 December 2013 |quote=The National Association of Pension Funds surprised the City yesterday with the announcement of the departure of David Cranston, its director-general, after just 18 months in the job. Mr Cranston said he wanted a change after a "intense and successful" period for both the NAPF and the pensions industry.}} ==Education== David Cranston was educated at [[Strathallan School]] in [[Perthshire]] and the [[Royal Military Academy, Sandhurst]]. ==Army== Following graduation Cranston was promoted from officer cadet to 2nd lieutenant with [[The Royal Artillery]] on the 29 July 1966.{{London Gazette |issue=44126 |supp=y |pages=10604–10605 |date=29 September 1966 }} He was promoted to lieutenant on the 29 January 1968,{{London Gazette |issue=44513 |supp=y |page=1181 |date=26 January 1968 }} captain on the 29 July 1972,{{London Gazette |issue=45738 |supp=y |pages=9155–9156 |date=31 July 1972 }} and major on the 31 December 1977.{{London Gazette |issue=47432 |supp=y |page=310 |date=10 January 1978}} Cranston transferred from the Royal Artillery to the [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|Army Air Corps]] on the 1 January 1979.{{London Gazette |issue=47745 |supp=y |page=656 |date=15 January 1979 }} In 1983 Cranston served as Chief of Staff at the headquarters of British Forces in [[Belize]]. On the 30 June 1984 he was promoted to lieutenant colonel.{{London Gazette |issue=49807 |supp=y |page=656 |date=17 July 1984 }} From 1984-1986 he was based at [[Defence College of Management and Technology|RMCS Shrivenham]]. In 1986 he was appointed Commander of 4 Regiment, Air Army Corps and in 1988 Chief of Staff of the [[2nd Infantry Division (United Kingdom)|2nd Infantry Division]]. On the 31 December 1990 he was promoted to brigadier.{{London Gazette |issue=52427 |supp=y |page=1043 |date=21 January 1991 }} From 1990-1992 he was Commander of [[Army Air Corps (United Kingdom)|British Army Aviation]] in Germany. In 1992 he was appointed Deputy, Head of Mission of the [[European Union Monitoring Mission]] to the former [[Yugoslavia]]. On the 12 June 1993 he was appointed a [[Commander of the Order of the British Empire]].{{London Gazette |issue=53333 |supp=y |page=34 |date=11 June 1993 }} From 1994-1995 Cranston was Deputy Commander of the [[Multinational Division Central|Multinational Airmobile Division]] based in [[Germany]]. He retired from the Army on 14 May 1995.{{London Gazette |issue=54035 |supp=y |page=6941 |date=15 May 1995}} ==Executive appointments== * Head of Member Relations, Personal Investment Authority, 1995-1997.{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/people--business-1286777.html |title=People & Business |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |date=4 December 1997 |accessdate=18 November 2012}} * Head of Group Compliance, [[The Royal Bank of Scotland]], 1997-2000. * Director General of the National Association of Pension Funds, 2000-2001.{{cite web |url=http://search.proquest.com/docview/245525897/1422D0AD61C354E7650/1?accountid=15842 |title=Ex-pilot lands in combat zone: Interview: David Cranston, director general, National Association of Pension Funds |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=29 July 2000 |page=24 |accessdate=5 December 2012 |quote=Cranston's shoes were barely under the director general's desk this month at the National Association of Pension Funds when the organisation - which represents fund managers in charge of pounds 450bn - issued its first warnings about the bonuses being handed out to Britain's corporate bosses.}} * Non-Executive Director, Voller Energy Group Plc, 2005-2009. * Non-Executive Director, [[Skandia]] UK, 2002-2008. * Non-Executive Director, [[National Olympic Committee]], 2001-2010.{{cite web |url=http://www.docstoc.com/docs/70091780/National-Olympic-Committe-Patron-HM-The-Queen-President-and-IOC- |title=National Olympic Committee |publisher=[[Docstoc]] |year=2012 |accessdate=18 November 2012}} * Member of the Executive Board, [[British Olympic Association]], 2007-2010. * Chairman, British Biathlon Union, 1996-2011.{{cite web |url=http://www.biathlonworld.com/de/letter/letterrender/index/code/ba0234a8fcb949741d79125f106a685a.html |title=News-Great Britain |publisher=[[International Biathlon Union]] |year=2011 |accessdate=18 November 2012}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cranston, David}} [[Category:1945 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People educated at Strathallan School]] [[Category:Graduates of the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst]] [[Category:Royal Artillery officers]] [[Category:British Army Air Corps officers]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:Scottish businesspeople]] [[Category:British businesspeople]] [[Category:British corporate directors]]

{{Multiple issues| {{refimprove|date=January 2009}} {{globalize|date=June 2008}} }}
'''Debt settlement''', also known as '''debt arbitration''', '''debt negotiation''' or '''credit settlement''', is an approach to debt reduction in which the [[debtor]] and [[creditor]] agree on a reduced balance that will be regarded as payment in full.<ref name="NYT1">{{cite web |first=Jane |last=Birmbaum |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/09/business/yourmoney/09credit.html?_r=1&pagewanted=all&oref=slogin |title=De bt Relief Can Cause Headaches of Its Own |publisher=''[[The New York Times]]'' |date=February 9, 2008 }}</ref> During a negotiation period, all payments by the debtor are made to the debt settlement company, which typically withholds payments to the creditors, even if the debtor has paid a lump sum or made payments. Once all the debtor's accounts are in default due to this non-payment, the debt settlement company has leverage to force the debtor to accept a reduced lump sum payment as settlement. The debtor's credit rating goes down significantly due to the default, especially if the debtor was not behind on payments before the negotiation period commenced. Even though the accounts are "settled," the default appears on the debtor's credit record for seven years. Nevertheless, some debtors prefer this method of debt reduction over bankruptcy.
Debt settlement is often confused with [[debt consolidation]] or [[debt management]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Khalfani-Cox|first1=Lynnette|title=Debt Management vs. Debt Settlement: Which Is Best?|url=http://www.aarp.org/money/credit-loans-debt/info-08-2011/debt-management-debt-settlement.html|website=AARP|accessdate=2 June 2017|date=11 Aug 2011}}</ref> In debt consolidation and debt management, the consumer makes monthly payments to the debt consolidator, who takes a fee and passes the rest on to the creditors; this way, creditors continue to receive payments each month. In debt settlement, the consumer makes monthly payments, out of which the debt settlement company takes its fees for the legal work or negotiation and payments are paid to the creditor. The debt settlement company may persuade the creditor to accept a settlement less than the amount the debtor pays, with the debt settlement company keeping the difference.
Debtors may use debt settlement instead of conventional debt management because they are not aware of debt management.
== History ==
As a concept, lenders have been practicing debt settlement for thousands of years.<ref>[http://www.swarthmore.edu/SocSci/soconne1/documents/forgive.pdf Debt Forgiveness: Plainer Speaking, Please.]</ref> However, the business of debt settlement became prominent in America during the late 1980s and early 1990s when bank [[deregulation]], which loosened [[consumer lending]] practices, followed by an economic [[recession]] placed consumers in financial hardships.
With charge-offs (debts [[Write-off|written-off]] by banks) increasing, banks established debt settlement departments staffed with personnel who were authorized to negotiate with defaulted cardholders to reduce the [[Balance (accounting)|outstanding balances]] in hopes to recover funds that would otherwise be lost if the cardholder filed for [[Chapter 7, Title 11, United States Code|Chapter 7 bankruptcy]]. Typical settlements ranged between 25% and 65% of the outstanding balance.<ref>[http://www.creditcardnation.com/testimony-20070416.pdf Testimony of Dr. Robert Manning before the FTC]</ref>
Alongside the unprecedented spike in [[personal debt]] loads, there has been another rather significant (even if criminally under reported) change – the 2005 passage of legislation that dramatically worsened the chances for average Americans to claim Chapter 7 bankruptcy protection. As things stand, should anyone filing for bankruptcy fail to meet the Internal Revenue Service regulated ‘means test’, they would instead be shelved into the Chapter 13 debt restructuring plan. Essentially, [[Chapter 13, Title 11, United States Code|Chapter 13 bankruptcies]] simply tell borrowers that they must pay back some or all of their debts to all unsecured lenders. Repayments under Chapter 13 can range from 1% to 100% of the amounts owed to unsecured creditors, based on the ability of the debtor to pay. Repayment periods are 3 years (for those who earn below the median income) or 5 years (for those above), under court mandated budgets that follow IRS guidelines, and the penalties for failure are more severe.
== Process ==
Debt settlement is the process of negotiating with creditors to reduce overall debts in exchange for a lump sum payment. A successful settlement occurs when the creditor agrees to forgive a percentage of total account balance. Normally, only unsecured debts not secured by real assets like homes or autos can be settled. [[Unsecured debt]]s include medical bills and [[Credit card debt]] - not student loans, auto financing or mortgages. For the debtor, this makes obvious sense, they avoid the stigma and intrusive court-mandated controls of bankruptcy while still lowering, sometimes by more than 50%, their debt balances. Whereas, for the creditor, they regain trust that the borrower intends to pay back what he can of the loans and not file bankruptcy (in which case, the creditor risks losing all moneys owed).
Negotiating with a collection agency or junk debt buyer is somewhat similar to negotiating with a credit card company or other original creditor. However, many collection agencies (or junk debt buyers) will agree to take less of the owed amount than the original creditor, because the junk debt buyer has purchased the debt for a fraction of the original balance.<ref name="ZombieDebt">{{cite web|url=http://articles.moneycentral.msn.com/SavingandDebt/ManageDebt/ZombieDebtCollectorsDigUpYourOldMistakes.aspx|title=Stock quotes, financial tools, news and analysis - MSN Money|publisher=}}</ref> As a part of the settlement, the consumer can request that collection is removed from the [[credit report]], which is generally not the case with the original creditor. Even if the removal of the collection account from the consumer credit report has been successfully achieved as a condition of settlement during negotiations, the negative marks from the original credit card company will still remain, according to Maxine Sweet, a spokeswoman for credit reporting agency Experian.<ref name="MakeADeal"/>
Potential candidates for debt settlement will typically have an overwhelming debt that they can’t afford to pay, have poor credit or don’t care about negatively impacting their bad credit, and/or don’t qualify for Chapter 7 bankruptcy.<ref>{{cite web|title=What Is Debt Settlement: A Complete Guide |url=https://www.supermoney.com/debt-help/debt-settlement/ |publisher=SuperMoney |accessdate=June 19, 2018 }}</ref>
===United Kingdom=== In the U.K. you can appoint an Arbiter or legal entity to negotiate with the creditors. Creditors often accept reduced balances in a final payment and this is called '''full and final settlement''' but with debt settlement the reduced amount can be spread over an agreed term.
In the U.K. creditors such as banks, credit card, loan companies and other creditors are already writing off huge amounts of debt. Most creditors are open to negotiations and are willing to accept reductions of 50% or more. Debt settlement allows the public to spread payments out over a set term - instead of having to pay a lump sum in one go which is the case with Full and Final Settlement.
U.K. debt settlement is not to be confused with full and final settlement where debt management companies have been known to hold on to client funds in which case the creditors get nothing until they decide to settle. Furthermore, the debt management company usually instructs the consumer not to make any payments to creditors. The intended effect is to scare creditors into settling the debt for less than the full amount. Typically, however, creditors simply begin collection procedures, which can include filing suit against the consumer in court.<ref>{{cite web|title=US Federal Trade Commission, Facts for Consumers, "Knee Deep in Debt"|url=http://www.ftc.gov/bcp/edu/pubs/consumer/credit/cre19.shtm}}</ref> As long as [[consumer]]s continue to make minimum monthly payments, creditors will not negotiate a reduced balance. However, when payments stop, balances continue to grow because of late fees and ongoing interest.<ref name="NYT1"/> This practice of holding client funds is regarded as unethical in the U.S. and U.K.
===United States=== U.S. debt settlement differs slightly. There are several indicators that few consumers actually have their debt eliminated by full and final settlement. A survey of U.S. debt settlement companies found that 34.4% of enrollees had 75 percent or more of their debt settled within three years.<ref>{{cite web|last=TASC |title=Letter from the Association of Settlement Companies (TASC) to the Federal Trade Commission, commenting on the FTC's proposed amendments to the Telemarketing Sales Rule on the marketing of debt relief services at 9-11 |url=http://www.ftc.gov/os/comments/tsrdebtrelief/543670-00202.pdf |publisher=FTC |accessdate=Oct 26, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100602151345/http://www.ftc.gov/os/comments/tsrdebtrelief/543670-00202.pdf |archivedate=2010-06-02 |df= }}</ref> Data released by the Colorado Attorney General showed that only 11.35 percent of consumers who had enrolled more than three years earlier had all of their debt settled.<ref>{{cite web |last=Press Release |title=Attorney General Unveils First Annual Report On Debt Settlement, Credit Counseling Business Practices |url=http://www.coloradoattorneygeneral.gov/press/news/2009/10/15/attorney_general_unveils_first_annual_report_debt_settlement_credit_counseling |publisher=Colorado Attorney General |accessdate=Oct 15, 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100204190809/http://www.coloradoattorneygeneral.gov/press/news/2009/10/15/attorney_general_unveils_first_annual_report_debt_settlement_credit_counseling |archivedate=2010-02-04 |df= }}</ref> And when asked to show that most of their customers are better off after debt settlement, industry leaders said that would be an "unrealistic measure." <ref name="GAO Report">{{cite web|last=GAO Report|title=Debt Settlement: Fraudulent, Abusive and Deceptive Practices Pose Risk to Consumers|url=http://www.gao.gov/new.items/d10593t.pdf|publisher=GAO|accessdate=Apr 22, 2010}}</ref>
Consumers can arrange their own settlements by using advice found on web sites, hire a [[lawyer]] to act for them, or use debt settlement companies.<ref name="NYT1"/> In a New York Times article Cyndi Geerdes, an associate professor at the University of Illinois law school, states "Done correctly, (debt settlement) can absolutely help people". However, stopping payments to creditors as part of a debt settlement plan can reduce a consumer's [[credit score]] from 65 to 125 points, with higher impacts on those who were current on their payments prior to enrolling in the program.<ref name="GAO Report"/> And missed payments can remain on a consumer's credit report for seven years even after a debt is settled.<ref name="GAO Report"/>
Some settlement companies may charge a large fee up front, which ignores a rule from the Federal Trade Commission.<ref>{{cite web|last=Consumer Advocates |title=Debt Settlement Company Evasion of Amendments to TSR |url=http://www.cambridge-credit.org/pdf/ftcopenletter12132010.pdf |publisher=Cambridge-Credit.org |accessdate=Dec 13, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120313165334/http://www.cambridge-credit.org/pdf/ftcopenletter12132010.pdf |archivedate=2012-03-13 |df= }}</ref>
Or they take a monthly fee from customer bank accounts for their service, possibly reducing the incentive to settle with creditors quickly. One expert advises consumers to look for companies that charge only after a settlement is made, and charge about 20 percent of the amount by which the outstanding balance is reduced.<ref name="NYT1"/> Other experts say debt settlement is a flawed model altogether and should be avoided.<ref>{{cite web |last=Center for Responsible Lending |title=The Debt Settlement Industry |url=http://www.responsiblelending.org/other-consumer-loans/debt-settlement/research-analysis/the-debt-settlement-industry.html |publisher=Center for Responsible Lending |accessdate=Jan 20, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111229181853/http://www.responsiblelending.org/other-consumer-loans/debt-settlement/research-analysis/the-debt-settlement-industry.html |archivedate=2011-12-29 |df= }}</ref>
==Professional debt settlement==
Depending on the country, different laws regulate professional debt settlement companies. In the United States, debt relief companies are required to provide information in advance of a consumer signing up for the services, including the cost and the terms. A legitimate company will use a [[Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation]]-insured trust account. Once enough funds are built up the negotiation process can begin with each creditor individually. Trust accounts, also known as "special purpose accounts," are often held by a bank, and managed by a bank agent (who charges a monthly maintenance fee). Accounts can also be held by creditors, or may be sold to collections agency for an average of $0.15 on the dollar, in which case debt can still be negotiated.
A consumer makes monthly payments to the debt settlement company, or to the bank (or bank agent) who holds the "trust" account. A portion of each payment is taken as fees for the debt settlement company, and the rest is put into the trust account. The consumer is told not to pay anything to the creditors. The debt settlement company's fees are usually specified in the enrollment contract, and may range from 10% to 75% of the total amount of debt to be settled.<ref>{{cite web|title=MSN Money, "Debt settlement: A costly escape"|url=http://articles.moneycentral.msn.com/SavingandDebt/ManageDebt/DebtSettlementACostlyEscape.aspx}}</ref> FTC regulations effective October 27, 2010 restrict debt settlement companies from collecting any fees from a debtor client for services until settlement with the creditor has been reached and at least one payment made.
===Advantages=== Settlement companies generally package their settlements into a larger bulk settlement with the creditor for 35% - 50% of the existing balances.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}} The debt settlement companies typically have built up a relationship during their normal business practices with the credit card companies and can come to a settlement agreement quicker and at a more favorable rate than a debtor acting on their own. With [[Global financial crisis of 2008|the current economic crisis]], more and more credit card companies may be willing to settle existing credit card debts rather than add to their already large written off bad debt.
===Disadvantages=== Debt settlement companies generally take a percentage of the savings of the forgiven debt as the fee for their services. The drop out rate of debt settlement programs is high if a monthly plan is greater than 36 months at 50% and consumers who find themselves in these sorts of debt situations tend to have trouble sticking to a structured payment program for an extended period of time. Plans 36 months or less have a completion rate of over 85% Good settlement companies will arrange monthly update calls, establish a plan where you could miss a payment or two (life happens) or finish the plan six months earlier if you are consistent with all monthly payments. Credit card accounts typically go into collection after they are charged off, typically 180 days after the last payment on the account. The debt settlement companies may not handle calls from the credit card companies, nor the collection agencies.Calls will slow down as the settlement company makes contact with the creditors. Legal action can be taken against the creditor if they violate the FDCP act.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ftc.gov/bcp/edu/pubs/consumer/credit/cre27.pdf|title=Consumer Information - Federal Trade Commission|publisher=}}</ref> A good settlement company works with their clients to protect them.<ref>https://www.nerdwallet.com/blog/finance/how-does-debt-settlement-work/[NerdWallet] February 26, 2016 </ref> Debtors can be sued by creditors seeking to recover debts and interest. This can be avoided by using companies with good standings and practices that protect consumers from these procedures.{16}
==Do-it-yourself debt settlement==
It is possible for a consumer to imitate the methods of professional debt settlement companies and many people report success in negotiating a debt settlement for themselves.<ref name="MakeADeal">{{cite web|url=http://articles.moneycentral.msn.com/SavingandDebt/ManageDebt/MakeADealWithDebtCollectors.aspx|title=Stock quotes, financial tools, news and analysis - MSN Money|publisher=}}</ref> Initiation of negotiations can begin by calling the customer service department of the credit card company. In general, the credit card company will only deal with a consumer when the consumer is behind on payments but capable of making a lump sum payment. A payment plan is not an option; the credit card company will demand that the consumer make a lump sum payment of the settlement amount.
===Advantages=== By negotiating debts on their own, debtors are able to save in fees that would otherwise be paid to a debt settlement company or an attorney. This option also gives the debtor more control over the process which may, or may not, be a motivational factor to continue successfully completing the process.
===Disadvantages=== While the do-it-yourself option offers the debtor more control and reduced fees, there are negatives generally associated with this option. Creditors have their own policies regarding debt settlement and certain creditors will not settle directly with consumers. Additionally, consumers may face less advantageous settlement rates on their own, as opposed to debt settlement companies that have relationships with creditors and can often package bulk settlements. Consumers may face difficulty getting through to decision makers or long delays in any negotiations or paperwork processing with the creditors. Furthermore, every creditor has different processes and procedures in how they determine settlement offers and terms. Not knowing those can leave a consumer in the dark. Settlement Companies have a Customer service department to assist consumers with any questions or difficulties that arise during their program. This support can be particularly valuable, especially in cases where creditors become aggressive. If an account were to escalate to legal status, a consumer settling on their own would need to seek out a third party for help. Unfamiliarity of the settlement process can be intimidating and mistakes can be made. You will need to beware of fine print and carefully review any correspondence, proposed settlement or agreement with a creditor. Settlement Agreements should be reviewed very carefully, perhaps by a third party, to make sure that all the terms are those that are agreed upon. Settling one’s debt can be an emotionally draining and difficult process.
== Creditor’s incentives ==
The creditor’s primary incentive is to recover funds that would otherwise be lost if the debtor filed for bankruptcy. The other key incentive is that the creditor can often recover more funds than through other collection methods. Collection agencies and [[Collection agency|collection attorneys]] charge commissions as high as 40% on recovered funds. Bad debt purchasers buy portfolios of delinquent debts from creditors who give up on internal collection efforts and these [[bad debt]] purchasers pay between 1 and 12 cents on the dollar, depending on the age of the debt, with the oldest debts the cheapest.<ref name="ZombieDebt"/> Collection calls and lawsuits sometimes push debtors into bankruptcy, in which case the creditor often recovers no funds.
== Common objections ==
'''Damages credit''' - Credit reports will show evidence of debt settlements and the associated [[FICO]] scores will be lowered temporarily as a result. However, if a "paid in full" letter is obtained from the creditor, the debtor's credit report should show no sign of a debt settlement. Additionally, as debtors settle their accounts the score starts to go back up again. Some Debt Settlement companies offer Credit Repair in their programs in order to erase some of the negative remarks on credit reports.
'''Potential for lawsuits''' - Though few creditors wish to push borrowers toward bankruptcy, (and the potential of governmental protection against all debts),there’s always the possibility of a [[lawsuit]] whenever debts lay unpaid. In the debt settlement process the debtor's accounts remain in default. While the debts are still in default the creditor or its assignee can still file a lawsuit against a debtor. Most creditors and debt collectors want a lump sum payment to settle for less than the full debt. Although a debtor may make monthly payments to the debt settlement company, the amount is too small to successfully negotiate a settlement until after the debtor has made several months' worth of payments.
'''Eligibility of debts''' - In addition, the specific debts of the borrowers themselves affect the success of negotiations. [[Tax liens]] and domestic judgments, for reasons that should be clear, remain unaffected by attempts at settlement. Student loans, even those not federally subsidized, have been granted special powers by recent legislation to attach bank accounts without possibility of Chapter 7 bankruptcy protection. Also, some individual creditors, including Discover Card, for example, tend to have an aggressive resistance against negotiations.
'''Tax consequences''' - Another common objection to debt settlement is that debtors whose debts are partially canceled outside the bankruptcy system will need to report the canceled portion of the debt as [[taxable income]]. (IRS Publication Form 982) The [[Internal Revenue Service]] (IRS) considers any amount of forgiven debt as taxable income.<ref>https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/f1099c.pdf</ref> The forgiving creditor must provide the taxpayer with a 1099-C tax form for amounts $600 or greater. This form will list the amount of forgiven debt and interest in Box 2. Taxpayers with portions of personal loans forgiven may not subtract the interest reported in Box 3 from the amount of reportable income on this form.
However, the IRS does not require taxpayers to report forgiven debt if the tax payer was [[insolvent]] at the time the creditor forgave the debt. Being insolvent means that the amount of a debtor’s debts are greater than his/her assets (how much money and property the debtor owns). However, the IRS adds that “you cannot exclude any amount of canceled debt that is more than the amount by which you are insolvent.”<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.irs.gov/publications/p525/ar02.html#d0e4707|title=Publication 525 (2015), Taxable and Nontaxable Income|publisher=}}</ref>
For example, if a taxpayer is $10,000 in debt and owns $3,000 in assets, he/she cannot exclude more than $7,000 of forgiven debt from his/her [[income tax]]. Any forgiven debt over $7,000 that year must be reported as taxable income.
== Criticism ==
In May 2009, the [[New York Attorney General]] issued [[subpoena]]s to fourteen "debt settlement" companies, looking for violations of New York law.<ref>New York Attorney General Press Release May 7, 2009 http://www.oag.state.ny.us/media_center/2009/may/may7a_09.html</ref> On May 19, 2009, the [[New York Attorney General]] filed suit against two "debt settlement" firms and their affiliates, alleging violations related to fraudulent business practices and false advertising.<ref>New York Attorney General Press Release May 19, 2009 http://www.oag.state.ny.us/media_center/2009/may/may19b_09.html</ref>
A March 2010 [[CBS]] ''[[Early Show]]'' story on the debt settlement industry cast a harsh light on major debt settlement firm [[Credit Solutions of America]]'s business practices, and provided consumer advice for debt settlement counseling.<ref>CBS News, Early Show, Beware Debt Settlement Companies, March 29, 2010, http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2010/03/29/earlyshow/contributors/susankoeppen/main6343617.shtml?tag=cbsnewsTwoColUpperPromoArea</ref>
=== Better Business Bureau rating ===
The [[Better Business Bureau]] has adopted an automatic downgrading policy for all debt settlement companies. In a written statement, the Council of Better Business Bureaus stated, "Debt negotiation/settlement businesses are downgraded in the BBB rating system based on BBB concerns with the debt negotiation/settlement industry. The FTC held a workshop on debt negotiation/settlement last fall, and similar concerns were expressed as to how the industry operates and the likelihood that debt negotiation/settlement benefits a significant number of consumers."
The Association of Settlement Companies (TASC), the professional association for the debt settlement industry, warned in a written statement that "under the BBB’s new rating system, it is virtually impossible for a debt settlement company to be rated anything other than a ‘D’ or ‘F’,". In a February letter TASC sent to the National Council of Better Business Bureaus, the organization alleged that “there are critical flaws in the BBB’s consumer grading system as it applies to settlement firms.” The letter expressed concern that all settlement companies will be given poor ratings, regardless of the number of consumer complaints, how those complaints have been resolved, or the business practices of the settlement firm under review. TASC says the dispute stems from the fact that the BBB does not consider debt settlement a viable option for consumers who cannot afford to pay back their debts and want professional help to negotiate lower payments.{{Citation needed|date=May 2010}}
== See also == * [[Debt]] * [[Debt consolidation]] * [[Bankruptcy]] * [[Credit counseling]] * [[Sponsored repayment]] * [[List of finance topics]] * [[Uniform Debt-Management Services Act]]
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}

Gray, Brooklyn Legal Services; as published by the FTC

{{Infobox university | name = | native_name = École Supérieure du Commerce Extérieur | image = Logo_ESCE_2017.png | motto = International in any language | established = 1968 | founder = [[Business France]] | type = [[Grande école]] | academic_affiliation = EPAS, Conférence des Grandes Ecoles | president = Catherine Lespine | dean = Jean Audouard | academic_staff = 62 Full-Time and 220 associated | students = 2,500 | city = [[France]] ([[Paris]] and [[Lyon]]) | campus = [[Urban area|Urban]] | language = English, French | colors = Blue and White {{Color box|#1354d6}} {{Color box|#ffffff}} | website = {{url|http://www.esce.fr}} }}
'''ESCE International Business School''' (ESCE - Ecole Supérieure du Commerce Extérieur) is a business school founded in 1968 by [[Business France]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.esce.fr/business-school/school/history/|title=History - ESCE Business School|last=|first=|date=2017|website=ESCE|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> (French Office for International Trade) and located in Campus Eiffel, Paris. It is a member of France's ''[[Conférence des Grandes écoles|Conférence des Grandes Ecoles]]'' since 2012.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.studyrama.com/formations/filieres/ecoles-de-commerce/actualites/lesce-devient-membre-de-la-conference-des-grandes-ecoles-1157905|title=L’ESCE devient membre de la Conférence des Grandes Écoles|last=|first=|date=|website=www.studyrama.com|archive-url=http://www.studyrama.com/formations/filieres/ecoles-de-commerce/actualites/lesce-devient-membre-de-la-conference-des-grandes-ecoles-1157905|archive-date=2017|dead-url=}}</ref> The school has ~ 2,500 students<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.esce.fr/business-school/school/key-figures/|title=Key Figures - ESCE Business School|last=|first=|date=2017|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> and 9,300 Alumni.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://esce-alumni.hivebrite.com|title=Welcome to ESCE Alumni|last=|first=|date=|website=esce-alumni.hivebrite.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
The school offers Bachelor degrees,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.letudiant.fr/palmares/palmares-des-ecoles-de-commerce-postbac-en-3-ans/esce-bachelor.html|title=ESCE BACHELOR|last=|first=|date=2017|website=l'Etudiant.fr|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> internationally accredited Masters in Management and Summer Programs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://summer.pariseiffel.fr/|title=SUMMER PROGRAMS|last=|first=|date=2017|website=summer.pariseiffel.fr|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
Among famous speakers, former Prime Ministers Tony Blair,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.laureate.net/NewsRoom/PressReleases/2014/04/Former-British-Prime-Minister-Tony-Blair-Applauds-Laureates-Student-Focus-at-Campus-Eiffel-in-Paris|title=Former British Prime Minister Tony Blair Applauds Laureate’s Student Focus at Campus Eiffel in Paris|last=|first=|date=4 April 2014|website=www.laureate.net|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Jean-Pierre Raffarin, Michel Rocard<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.esce.fr/business-school/blog/ecole/actualites/interview-michel-rocard-ancien-premier-ministre-de-la-france-par-farid-el-alaoui/|title=INTERVIEW WITH FORMER FRENCH PRIME MINISTER MICHEL ROCARD, BY FARID EL ALAOUI|last=|first=|date=|website=esce.fr|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> and Alain Juppé<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.esce.fr/ecole-commerce/blog/ecole/actualites/conference-alain-juppe-comment-panser-leurope-pour-la-repenser/|title=CONFÉRENCE ALAIN JUPPÉ - COMMENT PANSER L'EUROPE POUR LA REPENSER ?|last=|first=|date=22 May 2015|website=www.esce.fr|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> contributed to conferences at ESCE.
The Paris-based business school is renowned in France and Europe for its network of entrepreneurs, who founded some notable french start-ups ([[ESCE International Business School#Notable Companies founded by Alumni|Zenly, Simplified, Sixth June, Interactive Mobility...]]).
== Ownership == From 2001 till 2016, the school belonged to [[Laureate International Universities]], that sold all their French assets to perform their IPO.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/912766/000104746917000224/a2230660zs-1a.htm|title=REGISTRATION STATEMENT UNDER THE SECURITIES ACT OF 1933, Laureate Education, Inc.|last=|first=|date=18 January 2017|website=SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> The school now belongs to [[Apax Partners|APAX Partners]] investment fund,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.laureate.net/NewsRoom/PressReleases/2016/04/Agreement-between-Laureate-Education-and-Apax-Partners|title=Agreement between Laureate Education and Apax Partners|last=|first=|date=19 April 2016|website=laureate.net|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> which owns the INSEEC U network.
== Degree and Accreditation == The school delivers a Master in Management with EFMD EPAS accreditation<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.efmd.org/efmd-deans-across-frontiers/view/751-efmd-awards-epas-accreditation-to-programmes-at|title=EFMD Awards EPAS Accreditation to Programmes at ESCE, Bologna, Chulalongkorn and Salford|last=|first=|date=24 February 2015|website=EFMD|archive-url=|archive-date=24 February 2015|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> as well as French Ministry of Higher Education and Research accreditation. It also cofounded the Consortium of International Double Degrees (CIDD).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cidd.org/about-cidd/|title=ABOUT CIDD|last=|first=|date=|website=www.cidd.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
ESCE specializes in International Affairs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.letudiant.fr/examen/concours-ecole-commerce/ecoles-de-commerce-concours-sesame-mode-demploi-16450/quelle-est-la-vraie-selectivite-du-concours-sesame-17827.html|title=Quelle est la vraie sélectivité du concours Sésame ?|last=|first=|date=2017|website=L'Edudiant|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> For long it has been the most demanded school within [https://www.concours-sesame.net/ SÉSAME]<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://actualites.prepa-hec.org/2008/11/le-concours-sesame-officialise-les-statistiques-de-la-session-2008/0457|title=Le concours SESAME officialise les statistiques de la session 2008|last=|first=|date=2008|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Examination (famous Business School examination in France), of which it was a founding member in 1992.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://actualites.prepa-hec.org/2008/11/le-concours-sesame-officialise-les-statistiques-de-la-session-2008/0457|title=Le concours SESAME officialise les statistiques de la session 2008|last=|first=|date=2008|website=prepa-hec.org|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
It is renowned for its dual degree<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hwr-berlin.de/fachbereich-wirtschaftswissenschaften/studiengaenge/internationales-management-management-international-bama-dtfr/|title=Deutsch-französischer Studiengang Gefördert durch die Deutsch-Französische Hochschule|last=|first=|date=|website=hwr-berlin.de|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> with [[Berlin School of Economics and Law|Berlin School of Economics & Law]], often referred as one of Germany's best Business Schools,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.hwr-berlin.de/en/service/news/single-view/article/hwr-berlin-germanys-best-business-school-1/|title=HWR Berlin "Germany's BEST Business School"|last=|first=|date=March 2016|website=hwr-berlin.de|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref> as well as its dual degree with [[University of International Business and Economics (Beijing)|UIBE Beijing]], one of China's remarkable Business schools.
== Notable teachers == [[:fr:Jean-Marie Cambacérès|Jean-Marie Cambacérès]] (Associated Professor since 2010) - [[École nationale d'administration|ENA]] Graduate (Promotion Voltaire),<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://iconicphotos.org/2012/03/13/promotion-voltaire/|title=Promotion Voltaire|last=|first=|date=|website=Iconic Photos|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Former Congressman (député), Business Man, President of European & Global Affairs at [[French Economic, Social and Environmental Council|CESE]] (Conseil Economique, Social et Environnemental), founder of ESCE Centre Asie.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.esce.fr/centreasie/|title=ESCE CENTRE ASIE|last=|first=|date=2017|website=esce/centreasie|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
== Notable Alumni == Alexandre de Rothschild, Chairman of [[Rothschild & Co]] bank.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lesechos.fr/16/04/2018/lesechos.fr/0301570831726_comment-alexandre-de-rothschild-s-est-prepare-a-reprendre-le-flambeau.htm|title=Comment Alexandre de Rothschild s'est préparé à reprendre le flambeau - Les Echos|website=www.lesechos.fr|language=fr|access-date=2018-08-27}}</ref>
== List of Dual Degree Programs == * BITS – Business And Information Technology School - (Campus Berlin & Iserlohn) (Germany) * Hochschule Augsburg – University Of Applied Sciences (Germany) * Hochschule Mainz- University Of Applied Sciences (Germany) * [[Berlin School of Economics and Law|Hochschule für Wirtschaft und Recht Berlin]] (HWR) (Germany) * [[University of International Business and Economics (Beijing)|UIBE – University of International Business and Economics]] (China) * [[CEU Cardinal Herrera University|Universidad Cardenal Herrera Ceu]] (Spain) * [[Universidad Europea de Madrid]] (Spain) * [[Coastal Carolina University]] (USA) * [[Kendall College]] (USA) * [[Nicholls State University]] (USA) * [[Dublin Business School]] - Griffith College Dublin (Ireland) * [[London South Bank University]] (United Kingdom) * [[Robert Gordon University]] (United Kingdom) * [[University of Brighton]] (United Kingdom) * [[University of Westminster]] (United Kingdom) * [[Nottingham Trent University]] (United Kingdom) * [[University of South Wales|South Wales University]] (United Kingdom) * [[University of Maribor]] (Slovenia) * [[Linnaeus University]] (Sweden) * [[Karlstad University|University of Karlstad]] (Sweden)
== Notable Companies founded by Alumni == Zenly, acquired by Snapchat in 2017 for USD 250 to 350 Million, quoted by [[Les Échos (newspaper)|Les Echos]] to be part of top 10 most expensive french start-ups ever created.
Simplifield, analytics platform for the retail industry, USD 4 Million raised.
Interactive Mobility, entertainment platform for planes and cabs; €4 Million fundraising ongoing.
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Business schools]]

'''Elemental cost planning''' is a system of [[Cost planning]] and [[Cost control]], typically for buildings, which enables the cost of a scheme to be monitored during design development.
1951 saw the publication of the Ministry of Education Building Bulletin No 4 which essentially introduced the concept of elemental cost planning to the UK construction industry. Its Author was James Nisbet. The concept has been refined and developed over more than 50 years in the UK by [[BCIS]] (the Building Cost Information Service of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors).
Elemental Cost Planning relies upon the adoption of a Standard Form of Cost Analysis for buildings which allows costs to be compared on a common format and forms the basis of the benchmarking analysis central to the concept of Elemental Cost Plans.
It should :- *Ensure that the tender amount is close to the first estimate, or that any likely difference between the two is anticipated and is acceptable. *Ensure that the money available for the projects is allocated consciously and economically to the various components and finishes. *Always involves the measurement and pricing of approximate quantities at some stage of the process. *Aim to achieve good value at the desired level of expenditure.
Elemental cost planning is often referred to as 'designing to a cost' or 'target cost planning' since a cost limit is fixed for the scheme and the architect must then prepare a design not to exceed this cost. == See also == *[[Cost overrun]] *[[Comparative cost Analysis]] *[[BCIS]] *BCIS submits data exchange standard for UN ratification.[http://www.bcis.co.uk/site/scripts/news_article.aspx?newsID=137]
==References== *Cost planning of buildings - Douglas J Ferry (and others) *Cost studies of buildings 4th edn- Alan Ashworth *BCIS Standard Form of Cost Analysis (Analysis Forms) *BCIS Elemental Standard Form of Cost Analysis 4th edn *BCIS Principles of Elemental Classification for Buildings (International) *BCIS Proposed Standard form of Civil Engineering Cost Analysis [http://www.bcis.co.uk/site/scripts/download_info.aspx?fileID=108]

{{Infobox Officeholder |name=Felix A. Obuah |image= |imagesize= |caption= |order= |office1=Sole Administrator of the [[Rivers State Waste Management Agency]] |governor1=[[Ezenwo Wike]] |term_start1=June 2015 |term_end1= |predecessor1= |office2=Chairman of the
[[Rivers State People's Democratic Party]] |term_start2=2013 |term_end2= |lieutenant2= |predecessor2=[[Godspower U. Ake]] |successor2= |state= |district= |term_start = |term_end = |predecessor= |successor= |state3= |district3= |term_start3 = |term_end3 = |predecessor3= |successor3= |birth_name= Felix Amaechi Obuah |birth_date= 16 December |birth_place=[[Omuku|Omoku, Rivers State]] |residence = Eagle Island, [[Port Harcourt]] |death_date= |death_place= |religion= |profession= Businessman, politician, philanthropist |party=[[Rivers State People's Democratic Party|People's Democratic Party]] (PDP) |father = Bethel Chukujindu Obuah |spouse= |footnotes= |website= }} '''Felix Amaechi Obuah''' (born 16 December) is a Nigerian [[business magnate]], [[politician]] and [[philanthropist]] originally from [[Omoku, Rivers State]], Nigeria. He has been the chairman of the [[Rivers State People's Democratic Party]] since 2013 and was reelected in May 2016 for his second term. Obuah has a bachelor's degree in Business Administration from the [[University of Ibadan]]. With a business career spanning over 25 years, his diverse interests range from properties, real estate, hotels, resorts, oil, trading and construction. Obuah has served as council chairman of [[Ogba–Egbema–Ndoni]] local government area in Rivers State. He has also served as the national chairman of Oil Mineral Producing Areas Landlords Association of Nigeria (OMPALAN).{{cite web|url=http://fezinatgroup.com.ng/our-team.html|title=Our Team|publisher=Fezinat Group|date= |accessdate=5 November 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2013/04/new-rivers-pdp-chair-resumes-at-party-secretariat/|title=New Rivers pdp chair resumes at party secretariat|last=Onoyume|first=Jimitota|publisher=''[[Vanguard (Nigeria)|Vanguard]]''|date=19 April 2013|accessdate=5 November 2014}}{{cite news|url=http://www.nationalnetworkonline.com/vol11n41/fayose.html/|title=Rivers PDP Chairman, Bro Obuah, Congratulates Gov Faose On Inauguration|last=|first=|publisher=''[[National Network (newspaper)|National Network]]''|date=|accessdate=5 November 2014}} Obuah was a regular fixture of the 2015 elections, as he demonstrated unwavering resilience in his determination to ensure the election of [[Ezenwo Nyesom Wike]]. In June 2015, he was appointed Sole Administrator of the [[Rivers State Waste Management Agency]].{{cite news|title=Refuse Contractors, Others Jitter As Obuah Takes over RIWAMA|url=http://www.nationalnetworkonline.com/vol12n23/Refuse%20Contractors,%20Others%20Jitter%20As%20Obuah%20Takes%20over%20RIWAMA.html|accessdate=22 June 2015|work=[[National Network (newspaper)|National Network]]|date=13 June 2015}} ==Personal life== His father Bethel Chukujindu Obuah, a devout Christian, died aged 85 in 2016.{{cite news|author=|url=http://www.thetidenewsonline.com/2016/08/05/banigo-extols-pa-obuah/|title=Banigo Extols Pa Obuah|work=[[The Tide (Nigeria)|The Tide]]|location=Port Harcourt|date=5 August 2015|accessdate=11 August 2016}} ==See also== *[[Krisdera Hotel Omoku]] *[[Go Round F.C.]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Rivers State People's Democratic Party}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Obuah, Felix}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Rivers State People's Democratic Party chairs]] [[Category:Nigerian philanthropists]] [[Category:Nigerian hoteliers]] [[Category:Nigerian businesspeople]] [[Category:University of Ibadan alumni]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Rivers State]] [[Category:Heads of Rivers State government agencies and parastatals]] [[Category:People from Ogba–Egbema–Ndoni]] [[Category:Mayors of places in Rivers State]] [[Category:21st-century Nigerian politicians]] {{RiversState-politician-stub}}

'''Fredrik Christopher Blom''' (14 July 1893 – 5 September 1970) was a Norwegian businessperson.
==Personal life== He was born in [[Oslo|Kristiania]] as a son of Andreas Ebeltoft Blom (1853–1901) and Birgitte Bull Lied. In 1917 he married Alethe Heyerdahl Vogt, a daughter of ambassador and politician [[Paul Benjamin Vogt]] (1863–1947) and Daisy Heyerdahl (1864–1946).<ref name=hvem48>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1948|title=Blom, Fredrik|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1948/0062.html|page=62|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref> They had the son [[Chr. Fredrik Blom]].<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1973|title=Blom, Christian Fredrik|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1973/0064.html|pages=64–65|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref>
He was also a brother-in-law of [[Stener Vogt]],<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1948|title=Vogt, Stener|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1948/0572.html|page=572|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref> Daisy Vogt (first wife of [[Diderich H. Lund]])<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|year=|title=Diderich H Lund|encyclopedia=[[Norsk biografisk leksikon]]|first=Hans Eirik|last=Aarek|editor=[[Knut Helle|Helle, Knut]]|publisher=Kunnskapsforlaget|location=Oslo|url=http://www.snl.no/.nbl_biografi/Diderich_H_Lund/utdypning|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref> and Leiken Vogt (wife of [[Ferdinand Schjelderup]] and then cohabitant with [[Emil Stang, Jr.]]).<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|year=|title=Emil Stang|encyclopedia=[[Norsk biografisk leksikon]]|first=Jorunn|last=Bjørgum|editor=[[Knut Helle|Helle, Knut]]|publisher=Kunnskapsforlaget|location=Oslo|url=http://www.snl.no/.nbl_biografi/Emil_Stang/utdypning|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Career== After [[examen artium|finishing]] his secondary education in [[Skien]] in 1909<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Tillegg|url=http://runeberg.org/merkbio/0953.html|encyclopedia=[[Merkantilt biografisk leksikon]]|publisher=Yrkesforlaget|location=Oslo|edition=1st|editor-last=Hoffstad|editor-first=Einar|editor-link=Einar Hoffstad|year=1935|page=857|accessdate=16 February 2012|language=Norwegian}}</ref> and [[Oslo Commerce School|Kristiania Commerce School]] in 1910, Blom worked abroad for several years. He travelled in England, Russia and France from 1910 to 1914 and in East Asia and America from 1916 to 1917. He established his own company in 1921, and in 1927 he was hired as chief executive officer of industrial company [[Denofa|De-No-Fa]].<ref name=hvem48/><ref name=merkbio>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Blom, Fredr. Chr(istopher)|url=http://runeberg.org/merkbio/0163.html|encyclopedia=[[Merkantilt biografisk leksikon]]|publisher=Yrkesforlaget|location=Oslo|edition=1st|editor-last=Hoffstad|editor-first=Einar|editor-link=Einar Hoffstad|year=1935|page=87|accessdate=16 February 2012|language=Norwegian}}</ref> He retired in 1959 and was succeeded by his son Chr. Fredrik Blom, but continued as chair<ref>{{cite news|title=F. Blom går av som adm. direktør ved De-No-Fa|date=28 April 1959|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=8}}</ref> until 1965.<ref name=obit/>
He also chaired [[Lilleborg Fabriker]], was a board member of the [[Federation of Norwegian Industries (1919–1989)|Federation of Norwegian Industries]] and [[Brødrene Lever]] and was a supervisory council member of [[Bergens Privatbank]], [[Forsikringsselskapet Norden]] and ''[[Morgenbladet]]''. He chaired the [[Alliance Francaise]] branch in Oslo from 1935 to 1937, and was a Chevalier of the [[Legion of Honour]].<ref name=hvem48/><ref name=merkbio/> He headed the Norwegian committee in the [[International Chamber of Commerce]] and was vice president from 1948 to 1957, and chaired [[Norges Eksportråd]] from 1954 to 1966.<ref name=obit/>
He was also decorated as a Commander of the [[Order of St. Olav]] (1956) and of the [[Order of Homayoun]].<ref name=obit/> He died in September 1970<ref>{{cite encyclopedia|year=1973|title=Fortegnelse over personer som siste gang er omtalt i utgaven 1968 med angivelse av deres dødsdatum|encyclopedia=[[Hvem er hvem?]]|editor=Steenstrup, Bjørn|publisher=Aschehoug|location=Oslo|url=http://runeberg.org/hvemerhvem/1973/0624.html|page=624|language=Norwegian|accessdate=16 February 2012}}</ref> while vacationing in [[Geilo]].<ref name=obit>{{cite news|title=Fredrik Blom død|date=7 September 1970|work=[[Aftenposten]]|page=15}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{authority control}}

{{for|the rugby league footballer of the 1920s|Herbert Holt}} {{more footnotes|date=July 2012}} {{Infobox person | name = Sir Herbert Holt | image = Herbert Samuel Holt.jpg | alt = hia | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1856|02|12}} | birth_place = [[Geashill]], [[Co. Offaly]], [[Ireland]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1941|09|29|1856|02|12}} | death_place = [[Montreal, Quebec]], Dominion of [[Canada]] | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = President of the [[Royal Bank of Canada]] | occupation = civil engineer }} '''Sir Herbert Samuel Holt''' (February 12, 1856 – September 29, 1941) was an [[Ireland|Irish]]-born [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[civil engineer]] who became a businessman, [[banker]], and [[corporate director]] with a ruthless business reputation. He was President of the [[Royal Bank of Canada]], [[Montreal Light, Heat & Power]], and a director of some 250 companies worldwide, with assets valued at around $200 million. On his death, the [[Montreal Gazette]] described him as "the richest man in [[Canada]]", but he was also one of the most reviled. Among his peers in the [[Golden Square Mile]], "everyone respected his business ability, but nobody liked him personally".<ref>Remembrance of Grandeur - The Anglo-Protestant Elite of Montreal, by Margaret Westley (1990), page 202</ref> Holt was one of the founders of the Town of [[Hampstead, Quebec]]<ref>[[History of the Town of Hampstead]]</ref>
==Early life== Holt was born at Ballycrystal, near [[Geashill]], [[County Offaly|Co. Offaly]]. He was the second son of William Robert Grattan Holt, of Carberry House, [[Co. Kildare]], inherited in 1742 from his ancestor, Hannah Colley (afterwards Grattan) of Castle Carberry. Holt grew up with his family at another family property, Ballycrystal, a [[Grazing land|grazing farm]] of 291 [[acres]]. In reference to Holt's own ruthless business reputation, it is of interest to note that in a dispute between his father and his uncle, it was said that, "the business affairs of William Holt's family would not stand up to close scrutiny".<ref>Patterns of Migration - Patrick O'Sullivan, 1997</ref> Herbert Holt's elder brother, Thomas Grattan Holt, succeeded to Ballycrystal and Carberry, while Holt studied civil engineering in [[Dublin]]. In 1873, he emigrated to [[Canada]], beginning work as an assistant engineer with the [[Toronto]] Water Works. In the early 1880s, he was employed to survey and construct portions of the [[Canadian Pacific Railway]] across the prairies and through the [[Rocky Mountains]], under [[James Ross (Canadian businessman)|James Ross]].
==Career== Herbert Holt became a pioneer developer of the [[energy]] business in the [[Province of Quebec]] and owned the Montreal Gas Company. In 1901 he merged Montreal Gas with [[Rodolphe Forget|Rodolphe Forget's]] Royal Electric Company to create the [[Montreal Light, Heat & Power|Montreal Light, Heat & Power Company]]. In 1944, their successful conglomerate was [[Nationalization|nationalized]] by legislation passed by the [[National Assembly of Quebec|Legislative Assembly of Quebec]]. It came under the newly created Quebec Hydroelectric Commission, also known as [[Hydro-Québec]]. Holt served as president of the [[Royal Bank of Canada]] from 1908 to 1934, and the bank's chairman from 1934 until his death. He was a co-founder of the [[Ritz-Carlton Montreal]], a director of [[Montreal Trust Company]], [[Canada Car and Foundry]] and many other Canadian companies. He was appointed chairman of the [[Federal Plan Commission]] in 1913. In 1915, he was [[Knight Bachelor|knighted]] by [[George V|King George V]].<ref>{{London Gazette |issue=29094 |supp=y |pages=2363–2364 |date=9 March 1915 }}</ref> Herbert Samuel Holt died in 1941 and was interred in the [[Mount Royal Cemetery]] in Montreal. His comparatively modest home on [[Stanley Street (Montreal)|Stanley Street]] in Montreal's [[Golden Square Mile]] was demolished after his death. Following its formation in 1979, Herbert Holt's significant contribution to the Canadian economy was recognized through his election to the [[Canadian Business Hall of Fame]].
==Reputation== However, Holt was also one of the richest and most reviled Montrealers of his time. When his death was announced at a [[baseball]] game in 1941, the crowd cheered. To many [[French Canadian]]s, Holt was the epitome of 'les maudits anglais' ('the damned English'). {{Citation needed|date=March 2008}} Herbert is remembered for being a harsh banker who enjoyed large profits while the common man suffered during the [[great depression]]. In his own words, "If I am rich and powerful, while you are suffering the stranglehold of poverty and the humiliation of social assistance; if I was able, at the peak of the Depression, to make 150% profits each year, it is foolishness on your part, and as for me, it is the fruit of a wise administration."
==Family== [[File:Send Grove Surrey.JPG|thumb|Send Grove, Holt's home in [[Surrey]]]] In 1890, Holt married Jessie, the eldest daughter of Andrew Paton (1833-1892) of [[Sherbrooke, Quebec]]. The Holts kept three houses: One at 297 Stanley Street in Montreal's [[Golden Square Mile]]; another called Ballycrystal House, near [[Nassau, Bahamas|Nassau]] in the [[Bahamas]]; and a third called [[Send, Surrey|Send Grove]], near [[Woking]] in [[England]]. The Holts were the parents of three sons:
*Major Herbert Paton Holt (1890-1971) [[Military Cross|M.C.]], [[Member of Parliament|M.P.]], educated at the [[Royal Military College of Canada]], he inherited Send Grove and Ballycrystal.<ref>Kelly's Handbook to the Titled, Landed and Official Classes, Volume 95, 1969</ref> He fought in both world wars and wrote a history of his regiment, the [[3rd Dragoon Guards]]. He kept a house in [[Mayfair, London]] and in 1927 he purchased Lackham Manor, [[Wiltshire]], for £78,000. He was [[High Sheriff of Wiltshire]] and [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Upton (UK Parliament constituency)|Upton]], [[Essex]]. He married Elizabeth, daughter of George Lighthall Cains of Montreal and his wife Amy, sister of Percy Cowans of Montreal.<ref>J. W. Mcconnell: Financier, Philanthropist, Patriot - William Fong (2008), page 615</ref> One of their two daughters, Elizabeth, is the widow of [[Baron Fisher|John Vavasseur Fisher, 3rd Baron Fisher]]. Their only son, Lt. George Herbert Holt, was killed in the [[Second World War]].<ref>[http://www.lackham.co.uk/history/the_manor_of_lackham.pdf History of the Manor of Lackham]</ref> *Major Andrew Paton Holt (1893-1964), named for his maternal grandfather, he was educated at the [[Royal Military College of Canada]]. He successfully succeeded his father in many of his business ventures at Montreal. His friend, [[Max Aitken, Lord Beaverbrook|Lord Beaverbrook]], unsuccessfully attempted to purchase him a [[knighthood]].<ref>The Order of Canada: Its Origins, History, And Development - Christopher McCreery (2005), page 26</ref> Major Andrew Holt died from a heart attack in London, England, on 12 September 1964. *Major (William) Robert Grattan Holt (1900-1947), named for his paternal grandfather. He was educated at [[Marlborough College]] and the [[Royal Military College of Canada]]. In 1915, he survived the sinking of the [[RMS Lusitania]]. He served with the [[Royal Canadian Infantry Corps]] as a major during [[World War Two]]. He lived at Redpath Crescent, in Montreal's [[Golden Square Mile]], which he gave over to the Navy for use as a hospital during the [[Second World War]].<ref>[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1946&dat=19440224&id=L78tAAAAIBAJ&sjid=opgFAAAAIBAJ&pg=2710,8555505 Holt Home on Redpath Crescent turned over to Navy for use as Hospital - Montreal Gazette, Feb 24, 1944]</ref> He was the father of one daughter, Jane, known popularly as Pam and afterwards as Pam Dunn (1924-2008).<ref>[http://www2.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/story.html?id=9a995be7-08e1-4606-9eb6-88dbbae86dbd Montreal philanthropist Pam Dunn dies at 83, Montreal Gazette, 2008]</ref> Pam became a famous [[philanthropist]] in [[Montréal]] who supported the [[Royal Victoria Hospital, Montreal|Royal Victoria Hospital Foundation]], [[Bishop's University]], the Sun Youth Organization, Dans la rue, the [[Douglas Hospital]], the Montreal Association for the Blind, the Butters Foundation and numerous other charities.<ref>[http://www.rmslusitania.info/people/saloon/william-robert-holt/ The Lusitania Resource]</ref>
Holt, who was the father of three graduates of the [[Royal Military College of Canada]] and donated two hangars to the College in 1920 from the imperial war surplus stores in Canada. The hangars, which were free-freighted from Deseronto to Kingston, were erected as a covered skating rink.<ref>Preston Canada's RMC: A history of the Royal Military College of Canada (Kingston, 1969)</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Further reading== *[http://www.canadascapital.gc.ca/data/2/rec_docs/829_gatineau_summary_e.pdf The Creation and Early Development of Gatineau Park] {PDF} *[http://www.vieux.montreal.qc.ca/inventaire/fiches/fiche_pers.php?id=189&sec=o Vieux-Montreal: Sir Herbert S. Holt] *[http://www.offalyhistory.com/content/reading_resources/famous_people/herbertholt.htm Offaly Historical and Archaeological Society: Sir Herbert Samuel Holt] With a photograph. *[http://www.canada.com/nationalpost/news/story.html?id=ef13eb2c-e004-4fdd-83b7-a8a0ca987d83&k=69686 "Mount Royal's graves bring past to life", The National Post, 5 July 2006]

revision.text:
{{Use Singapore English|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} '''Ignatius Leong''' (born 1956) is a professional [[chess]] organizer in [[Singapore]] and has been one of [[Asia]]'s leading organizers for more than 20 years. He is FIDE Secretary-General and President of the ASEAN Chess Confederation, a 14-country zone, geographically the largest in the world. He is also Chairman of the FIDE Development Commission.
He was Asia’s first International Organiser and among the first to receive the title of FIDE Senior Trainer.<ref>[http://www.fide.com/info/arbiters-trainers?task=arbiter&aid=1799 Arbiters / Trainers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110606155452/http://www.fide.com/info/arbiters-trainers?task=arbiter&aid=1799 |date=6 June 2011 }}</ref> At 23, he became one of the world’s youngest International Arbiters. Leong is also Director of the ASEAN Chess Academy,<ref>[http://www.intchessasia.com/site/index.htm Intchess Asia Pte Ltd]</ref> which has produced many promising local talents and now attracts talent from around the region. He had played in three [[Chess Olympiad]]s.<ref>[http://www.olimpbase.org/players/9z3n1dzf.html OlimpBase Men's Chess Olympiads Ignatius Leong]</ref>
Politically, he has swung wildly from one extreme to the other. He once formed a "World Chess Organization", which promised to overthrow [[FIDE]]. However, he abandoned that effort when not enough people joined. He has also swung wildly between being a supporter and an opponent of FIDE President [[Kirsan Ilyumzhinov]].
In 2002, Leong announced that he was running for FIDE President against Ilyumzhinov. Later, he changed his mind, saying that he was not running. Then, changing it again, saying that he had never withdrawn his candidacy. It was eventually ruled that once he had withdrawn, it was too late to become a candidate again, so no election was held because Ilyumzhinov was the only candidate. However, Leong became FIDE Secretary-General.
==See also== *[[Singapore Chess Federation]]
==References== {{reflist}}

[[File:Bundenthal - Gasthaus Drei Könige, Schild.JPG|thumb]] [[File:Swansign.jpg|thumb]] '''Inn signs''' have a history that extends beyond the [[Middle Ages]], when many houses were identified by a sign, often a [[Heraldry|heraldic charge]], which signified that the premises were under the special care of a [[nobleman]], or a vivid image that impressed itself on the memory. The ruins of [[Herculaneum]] and [[Pompeii]] reveal that most of their street-front shops displayed an identifying sign outside.<ref>Eric R. Delderfield. ''Introduction to Inn Signs'', 1969.</ref>
In [[Ireland]] and the [[United Kingdom]] especially, the tradition, by which [[publican]]s were obliged to identify their premises by a sign, dating from the reign of [[Richard II of England|Richard II]],<ref>Delderfield 1969:12.</ref>is carried on today. A selection of inn signs carved on slabs and rescued after the [[Great Fire of London]] is preserved in the [[Guildhall]].
== External links == http://www.breweryartists.co.uk/ History of a now defunct studio and examples of painted signs
== Notes == {{commons cat|Inn signs}} {{Reflist}} {{history-stub}} [[Category:Signage]] [[Category:Service industries]]

[[KCA University]] |occupation = |profession = |cabinet = |committees = |portfolio = |religion = |signature = |signature_alt = |website = {{URL|www.sumraforchange.com}} |footnotes = |blank1 = |data1 = |nickname = }} '''Irshadali Mohamed Sumra''' (born 9 December 1962) is a [[Kenya]]n businessman and politician who was elected as a member of the [[Kenyan Parliament]] in the [[Kenya National Assembly elections in Nairobi, 2013|2013 parliamentary elections]].{{cite web |url=http://www.parliament.go.ke/plone/national-assembly/members-of-the-national-assembly/members/54910813 |title=Sumra , Irshadali Mohamed |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=10 March 2013 |work= |publisher= [[Kenyan Parliament]] |accessdate=4 May 2013}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Official website}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sumra, Irshad}} [[Category:1962 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Kenyan businesspeople]] [[Category:Orange Democratic Movement politicians]] [[Category:Members of the 11th Parliament of Kenya]] [[Category:Kenyan politicians of Indian descent]] {{Kenya-politician-stub}}

{{Infobox person | name = Jakov Bienenfeld | image = | imagesize = | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1948|07|28}} | birth_place = [[Zagreb]], [[SR Croatia]], [[Yugoslavia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2016|02|08|1948|07|28}} | death_place = [[Zagreb]], [[Croatia]] | relations = | spouse = | children = | nationality = [[Croats|Croat]] | occupation = [[Businessman]] }}
'''Jakov Bienenfeld''' (28 July 1948 – 8 February 2016) was a [[Croatian people|Croatian]] entrepreneur and developer.<ref name=ncl>{{cite news |url=http://arhiva.nacional.hr/clanak/20379/udario-bih-goldsteina-da-nas-nisu-razdvojili |title=Udario bih Goldsteina da nas nisu razdvojili |trans-title=I would have hit Goldstein were we not pulled apart |publisher=[[Nacional (weekly)|Nacional]] |language=Croatian |author=Plamenko Cvitić |date=12 September 2005 |accessdate=7 July 2012 |archivedate=7 July 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/68ysKsTw8?url=http://www.nacional.hr/clanak/20379/udario-bih-goldsteina-da-nas-nisu-razdvojili |df= }}</ref><ref name=aktual>{{cite news|url=http://www.aktual.hr/intervju/jakov-bienenfeld/u-posao-je-vazno-prvi-uci-ali-jos-vaznije-prvi-izaci|title=Jakov Bienenfeld: U posao je važno prvi ući, ali još važnije prvi izaći|publisher=Aktual|work=aktual.hr|language=Croatian|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120521215107/http://www.aktual.hr/intervju/jakov-bienenfeld/u-posao-je-vazno-prvi-uci-ali-jos-vaznije-prvi-izaci|archivedate=2012-05-21|df=}}</ref>
==Life and career== Bienenfeld was born in [[Zagreb]] on 28 July 1948 to a [[Jew]]ish family.<ref>{{harvtxt|Snješka Knežević|2011|p=80}}</ref> Most of his family perished during the [[Holocaust]].<ref name=hkv>{{cite news|url=http://www.hkv.hr/hrvatski-tjednik/10849-jakov-bienenfeld-hrvati-se-trebaju-prestati-ispriavati.html|title=Jakov Bienenfeld: O Židovima i hrvatskom 'istočnom grijehu'|publisher=Hrvatski list|work=hkv.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref>
His father, Zlatko Bienenfeld, was [[Major general]] of the [[Croatian Army]] and personal adviser to late Croatian [[Ministry of Defence (Croatia)|defence minister]] [[Gojko Šušak]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sesvete.hr/novosti/duboki-jarak,-17-godina-kasnije/1157|title=Duboki Jarak, 17 godina kasnije|work=sesvete.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref>
He was a prominent entrepreneur who owned several successful businesses, including a travel agency and a developing company.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://limun.hr/main.aspx?id=391436|title=Nakon stanova Jakov Bienenfeld u Šibeniku gradi poslovnu zgradu|publisher=Limun|work=limun.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.poslovni.hr/vijesti/bienenfeld-nisam-mogao-spasiti-generalturist-bit-cu-sretan-naplatim-li-potrazivanja-200936.aspx|title=Bienenfeld: Nisam mogao spasiti Generalturist, bit ću sretan naplatim li potraživanja|publisher=[[Poslovni dnevnik]]|work=poslovni.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref> In the 1990s Bienenfeld brought an exclusive German fashion brand [[Escada]] to Croatia.<ref name=aktual/> Bienenfeld was also a council member of the Zagreb Jewish community.<ref name=ncl/>
During the [[Croatian War of Independence]], in 1991, he co-organized aid convoy on ferryboat "Ilirija" to bring the humanitarian aid to bounded [[Dubrovnik]].<ref name=ncl/> With the help and cooperation from [[Slobodan Praljak]], Bienenfeld also co-organized rescue of more than 1,200 Jews from [[Sarajevo]] during [[Bosnian War]]. He testified in Praljak's favor during his trial at the [[International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia]].<ref name=hkv/>
During the last visit of [[President of Croatia]] [[Ivo Josipović]] to [[Israel]], when on February 2012 he addressed the [[Knesset]] apologising for the crimes committed against the Jews on Croatia's soil during [[World War II]], Bienenfeld stated; "''I think it is harmful to think that Croats need to redeem themselves for anything. Let's simplify the story, in the history one part of the Croats harmed my people and that is it. Done. Amen. Croats have nothing to redeem themselves for.''"<ref name=hkv/> Bienenfeld believed that Croats, as a nation, are not [[Antisemitism|Antisemits]]. He stated that he does not have antisemitic experiences in Croatia and that he is proud of the treatment Jews have in Croatia.<ref name="jl">{{cite news|url=http://www.jutarnji.hr/izgradnja-sinagoge-u-zagrebu-je-promasaj/1116155/|title='GRADNJA SINAGOGE U ZAGREBU JE PROMAŠAJ!' Najuspješniji židovski poduzetnik u Hrvatskoj Jakov Bienenfeld|publisher=[[Jutarnji list]]|work=jutarnji.hr|language=Croatian}}</ref>
Bienenfeld was an acquaintance of [[Ante Gotovina]] and has publicly supported him, stating that Gotovina is not guilty for the crimes he had been sentenced for.<ref name=hkv/> He resented former President of Croatia [[Stjepan Mesić]] interference with the split of the Zagreb Jewish Community, when Mesić supported [[Ivo Goldstein]], [[Slavko Goldstein]] and rabbi [[Kotel Da-Don]] in establishing the new Jewish community, Bet Israel. Bienenfeld stated that Mesić accused him of behaving like a [[Nazi]], although Bienenfeld is a Jew whose many family members have been killed during the Holocaust.<ref name=hkv/>
In 2013, during an interview for [[Jutarnji list]], Bienenfeld said that he is against the reconstruction of the [[Zagreb Synagogue]], primarily because of the future maintenance costs which Zagreb's Jewish community could not finance. In the interview he also noted that in 1994, when the first President of Croatia [[Franjo Tuđman]] told him that they should build the new synagogue which would be funded by the state government, Bienenfeld declined the offer, believing it to be inappropriate when 1800 Catholic churches were left destroyed at the time, during the [[Croatian War of Independence]].<ref name="jl"/>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Bibliography== {{Refbegin}} * {{cite book|last=Snješka Knežević|first=Aleksander Laslo|title=Židovski Zagreb|year=2011|publisher=AGM, Židovska općina Zagreb|location=Zagreb|isbn=978-953-174-393-8|ref=harv}} {{Refend}}
